chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)
Ignition Interlock Device Tampering/Failure to Install/Violate Court Order

result.execSummary:
The defendant DANIEL A. BLEVINS was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).
  • Ignition Interlock Device Tampering/Failure to Install/Violate Court Order, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 347.413(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Outstanding obligations are not a condition of probation and are to be paid directly to the Menominee Co. Clerk of Court office within 60 days. Debts older than 90 days  will be processed for tax intercept and civil judgments. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Payments plans are available.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. DANIEL A. BLEVINS

records.addlTxt: DNA proof of submission - DNA is already on file, no further test needed.
Menominee County DNA Proof of Submission - signed by DE

2:21 PM Prosecuting attorney Laura Nelson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant DANIEL A. BLEVINS in court.  Attorney Matthew Kolell in court for DANIEL A. BLEVINS. plea questionnaire waiver of rights filed. Defendant enters a plea of No Contest in Count 1, 2, & 3. Court advises party of their rights, finds factual basis, accepts defendant's waiver of their rights, the plea made, and finds guilty. State gives recommendation. Atty. Kolell ask for probation in ct 2 & 3. 

Sentence: Ct. 1 - $631 fine plus cost, 120 day license suspension, Ct 2 - $150 fine plus costs, 30 days jail, IID 6 month extension of IID, Ct 3 - $250 fine plus cost, 60 days jail, DNA sample and surcharge. 
May transfer to Langlade County jail, 2 day jail credit and huber approved.

ADDRESS INFO for DANIEL A. BLEVINS
Current: 112 Clermont APT D, Antigo, WI 54409 United States  (Effective: 04-07-2022)
Prior: S9263 SLOTTY RD, PRAIRIE DU SAC, WI 53578
Discovery letter - a copy of pages 1-16, as well as one DVD.
11:24 AM Defendant Daniel Blevins in court. DA Greg Parker in court. Defense Atty Mattew Kolell in court. Defense waives a formal reading of complaint , and enters a Not Guilty plea.

Pre-trial conference on May 27, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Final pre-trial on June 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.

11:24 AM Defendant DANIEL A. BLEVINS in court. Prosecuting Atty Gregory A. Parker appeared for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Matthew Kolell in court for Defendant DANIEL A. BLEVINS.  Defense waives the preliminary hearing, Court advises party of their right to a preliminary hearing, accepts waiver and binds over for Arraignment. DA Parker states that the Information will mirror the complaint.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 27, 2022 at 03:00 pm.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Notice of Hearing (prelim. hearing) - Not deliverable as addressed unable to forward.
